Vulnerability.Title: docker bug fix and enhancement update
Vulnerability.Description: Docker is an open-source engine that automates the deployment of any application as a lightweight, portable, self-sufficient container that will run virtually anywhere. The docker package has been upgraded to upstream version 1.2.0, which provides a number of bug fixes and enhancements over the previous version. Notable features include the new docker-devel subpackage, which contains the source libraries required for a docker rebuild. Additionally, the /etc/hosts, /etc/hostname, and /etc/resolv.conf files are now writable and the user can edit them in a running container. (BZ#1159893) Users of docker are advised to upgrade to this updated package, which fixes these bugs and adds these enhancements. After installing the update, docker containers must be restarted for the changes to take effect. Note for remediation: Please disable the SELinux for RHEL 4/5 when repairing, or some rpm packages will fail to install.
